item.title: Maddy Montaquila by Coffee and Open Source
item.description: Maddy Montaquila (formerly Leger) is a Senior Product Manager at Microsoft and the product lead for Aspire. She‚Äôs been building dev tools at Microsoft since 2018, working across the .NET mobile stack and helping bring .NET MAUI to life. Maddy has been obsessed with making developers‚Äô lives easier ever since her first dev tools internship, where she realized it perfectly combined her tech background with her passion for product development.These days, she‚Äôs focused on making modern distributed app development suck a whole lot less. Maddy‚Äôs an experienced speaker who‚Äôs presented everywhere from local user groups to major keynotes, known for bringing great energy and a genuine love for dev tools to every talk.You can find Maddy on the following sites:BlueskyLinkedInXGitHubPLEASE SUBSCRIBE TO THE PODCASTSpotifyApple PodcastsYouTube MusicAmazon MusicRSS FeedYou can check out more episodes of Coffee and Open Source on https://www.coffeeandopensource.comCoffee and Open Source is hosted by Isaac Levin

item.title: Square Theory
item.description: The story starts in Crosscord, the crossword Discord server. Over 5,000 users strong, the server has emerged as a central hub for the online crossword community, a buzzing, sometimes overwhelming, sometimes delightful town square where total noobs, veteran constructors, and champion solvers alike come together to talk about words that cross each other.

item.title: Coffee and Open Source Conversation - Maddy Montaquila
item.description:
Maddy Montaquila (formerly Leger) is a Senior Product Manager at Microsoft and the product lead for Aspire. She‚Äôs been building dev tools at Microsoft since 2018, working across the .NET mobile stack and helping bring .NET MAUI to life. Maddy has been obsessed with making developers‚Äô lives easier ever since her first dev tools internship, where she realized it perfectly combined her tech background with her passion for product development.
These days, she‚Äôs focused on making modern distributed app development suck a whole lot less. Maddy‚Äôs an experienced speaker who‚Äôs presented everywhere from local user groups to major keynotes, known for bringing great energy and a genuine love for dev tools to every talk.
You can follow Maddy on Social Media https://bsky.app/profile/maddymontaquila.net https://www.linkedin.com/in/maddyleger1/ https://x.com/maddymontaquila https://github.com/maddymontaquila

item.title: Api Key Authentication in ASP .NET Core (.NET 9)
item.description:
In this video, we break down how to implement secure and scalable API Key Authentication in ASP.NET Core (.NET 9) using both custom middleware and filters ‚Äî applicable to controller-based and minimal APIs.
üîç What You‚Äôll Learn:
- The core principles of API Key authentication. - When and why to use middleware vs filters. - How to implement secure API key validation in .NET 9. - Full walkthrough with both Controllers and Minimal APIs.
Support me on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/remigiuszzalewski Follow me on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/remigiusz-zalewski Follow me on Medium: https://medium.com/@remigiuszzalewski Source code: https://github.com/RemigiuszZalewski/YoutubeVideos/tree/main/Api%20Key%20Authentication
